H0.text: nickname given to railroad executives due to shady practices of their businesses. Industrial Kingpin

H1.text: nickname given to railroad executives due to shady practices of their businesses. Railroad Tycoon

H2.text: nickname given to railroad executives due to shady practices of their businesses. Corporate Raider

H3.text: nickname given to railroad executives due to shady practices of their businesses. Robber baron

A4.text: Robber baron (feudalism), an unscrupulous medieval landowner

A5.text: Robber baron (industrialist), term for unscrupulous 19th-century American businessmen

A6.text: Huntington came to symbolize the greed and corruption of late-nineteenth-century business.

A7.text: Railroad executives were vilified by Western farmers who absorbed the Granger movement theme that monopolistic carriers controlled too much pricing power, and that the state legislatures had to regulate maximum prices.
